reviews.title: Hotel ok.
reviews.text: After booking this hotel, I read some bad reviews on this website and was not expecting too much when we arrived. My husband and I stayed here on saturday night together with two other couples. We booked adjacent rooms, which we got, which were on the 7th floor. The rooms were small, but very clean and tidy. There was a damp patch on the ceiling, but that didnt bother us.We were awoken at 6am by noisy people coming in , some people show no respect for people that are asleep!!

reviews.title: Great beginning to the Contiki Experience
reviews.text: The English breakfast was served in a room in other side of the hotel, this was very busy!! This is a very touristy hotel and you have to expect a lot of people at breakfast. We struggled to get seats and had to sit seperately with other people. We lined up for our breakfast and a woman supervisor behind the serving counter was quite rude, People were asking her for what they wanted on their plates and I heard her saying 'oh my god' to the other girl because one person didnt want everything available. Wouldnt they prefer people to say what they dont want on their plate, instead of wasting good food? I asked for Bacon, egg and toast and got sausage banged on my plate regardless!! The breakfast was good however and there was easy access to juice and coffees etc.,

reviews.title: British Airways rating a total farce
reviews.text: All in all, this hotel is ok for a weekend break, but be warned it is very busy!!

reviews.title: Worst Than Terrible - Royal National
reviews.text: This was the hotel set up to stay at for my Contiki European Discovery tour in Summer 2006. It was a great stay for someone my age. Not too far from some of the major places to visit in London. The hotel is also very nice because you have your own room and bathroom to get ready in and sleep at!

reviews.title: Quite ok if you don't expect much of a room.
reviews.text: The use of a taxi was the best way to get around to the places you wanted to visit from here, you could also use the tube if you are comfortable with it (don't worry it's really easy to use and figure out!!)

reviews.title: A perfectly fine stay
reviews.text: After seeing previous reviews, I was a bit nervous, but very pleasantly surprised. The room was well furnished and clean. The staff were very polite and attentive. The location is superb with tube stop and bus access very near. Also close to good markets for drinks and snacks. There were several tour groups, some of whom were noisy in the courtyard. It was quiet by 11ish. We did have a fire alarm at 2 am our last night which was not pleasant. Fortunately, there was apparently no fire, and we were soon back in our room. I'm guessing the result of a prankster. I would definitely stay here again.

We booked for a theatre break so just stayed one night thankfully. It really is the pits as far as accomodation goes. My 15 year old daughter was stuck on a tiny pull out bed . The full English breakfast was absolutely appalling and tea and coffee undrinkable. Fortunately the trip to the Lion King was good but I would never stay there again
reviews.title: would not stay here again if you paid me

reviews.text: I first stayed at the Royal National in 2002 when I visited London on a Contiki tour. It's basic accommodation, no doubt about it, but the rooms are clean, you have your own bathroom which is a bonus in London hotels of that price bracket and it's in a good location - handy for the Russell Square tube station, British Museum etc.
reviews.title: Royal Accommodation

reviews.text: Anyway, I was happy enough with it to choose to stay there independently a few years later when I returned to London and it didn't let me down then either. Sure, it's touristy and you might get a bit of noise from the quadrangle in the middle if a tour is leaving but it also has a pub and a few shops attached to it as well as a big dining room and bar. Continental breakfast was included and wasn't too bad. The reception had been remodelled between trips and it looks much more modern. You can also leave your bags there in a secure room for a small price - I think it might have been 2 pounds - which was really handy when we went on quick trips out of London.
reviews.title: Not good !

reviews.text: It's not luxury by any means and the carpet is well-worn with the feet of thousands of Australian 18-35s but I'd stay there again for cheap and cheerful accommodation in the heart of London.
reviews.title: not bad at all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There's a reason this hotel is not listed in any of the major hotel search sites. We only stayed here one night and it was the worst night in a hotel we've ever had. It felt like we were in a third world country. Room was cramped, smelly and old. No toiletries and only one towel abou the size of a large hand towel. Couldn't sleep because of the noise from the courtyard below, fighting and arguing all night. TV only picked up one station and that one was in and out. There were NO British folk staying here, only unsuspecting tourists. Large tour crowds, noisy and rude. The breakfast was okay. I think the place was overpriced for what you don't get.
reviews.title: you've gotta be kidding

reviews.text: Stayed for New Years Eve in a family room with one twin and two single beds paying £120 including full breakfast. The hotel is in a good central location, has an excellent well priced bar, friendly staff, easy parking facility (under hotel, £15 per day), clean throughout and a tasty breakfast selection. All in all great value.
reviews.title: Made a great New Years Eve

likes.liked: — Location and price (and easy to find)

reviews.text: If you want five star go and pay five star prices!
reviews.title: Look elsewhere

reviews.text: I stayed at the RN before a Contiki tour, to have a convenient base in London from before my tour departed. I found it to be more of an inconvenience.
reviews.title: Yuk, yuk, yuk!!!

likes.disliked: — Staff were the rudest I've ever encountered in any hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Instead of being placed with someone else who was staying a few nights like I was, I had a new room-mate every night. I also noticed that whilst the towels were changed daily, between each new roomie the sheets were not changed at all. Yuk.
reviews.title: Dirty hotel and very worn down...
Good value based on what you pay!!!
reviews.text: Booked this as a Saturday night stop over, whilst meeting up up with a "few of the boys".

reviews.title: Dont go if you like to fell clean
reviews.text: Did obviously read the reviews but based on location and reason for the trip, felt it would be a good trade off. My wife was here in November last year, for a ladies shopping trip and felt it was decent value but not stunning in any way.

reviews.title: Accept the Royal National for what it is.
reviews.text: To put you in the picture, I'd been in London all week on business and staying in a 5*, so it did a lot of get any pass marks!!!

reviews.title: very budget accomodation
reviews.text: Check in was no more than 2 minutes and we were allowed to do so at 12.30 - good start there. Room was a twin and had all you'd expect as a minimum - we were in the same block as check in but looking inwards, not over the reception area.

reviews.title: Trying to be fair
reviews.text: Didn't return to the hotel till - let's just say the very early hours of the following morning and no bother with noise or disturbances of any description.
